description: Deja Dup doesn't even come close to this. Way more configurable, easier to set up, exclusion presets, etc.

Hello,

I backed up USB Drive, using password encryption.

Then attempted to remount the encrypted files, using the ''Existing Repository'' option on the App.

ERROR MESSAGE: Repository not recognised as not created from Pika BACK UP.
-------------------------------------------------------------

Failed to measure available space: The specified location is not supported

Generic Operation: Not enough free space in repository. - Insufficient free space to complete transaction (required: 169.14 kB, available: 0 B).

This happens on both my smb shares
great tiny tool for doing backups without having to open the terminal.

I keep getting an access denied error when trying to get this to work with Borgbase. Found 0 documentation on how to initialize a new Borgbase repo, even though Borgbase sponsors this project. Half-baked alpha projects like this are exactly what gets open source such a bad rap for poor usability.
If backing up to a remote location, make sure to install borgbackup on the remote too
Pika Backup is very easy to use, fast and has a nice UI
I use it to manage borg repos on external storage with passphrase encryption
Work perfectly! I prefer this over Déjà Dub, because this application allow you to make backups to multiple locations.
Pika Backup is simple to use, fast to backup, allows backup encryption and just works. The UI is clean and easy to understand.
4/5 because I can't seem to schedule backups to automatically run which is pretty important in my opinion.
Not the most streamlined method, but it works
Incredibly fast, and super reliable so far. Thank you so much for the hard work making Borg so easily usable!
summary: Blazingly Fast, super reliable so far

description: The UI looks great and I'm confident this is going to make a great successor to Vorta for borg.
Did exactly what I wanted it to without any fuss, would love to see scheduled backups in the future! Aside from that, it's an awesome application.
Don't expect this app to do anything fancy (yet), but it handles a basic backup setup very well. It allows for encrypted and deduplicated backups, and you can mount previous backups.
It is pretty simple, just select plugin your pen-drive (or connect to your respective remote server) click back-up, setup a password for back (optional) and you're done.
Very well done. Clean UI and robust backup process compared to other options (i.e. no errors or performance problems in sight).
Easily backed up my /home partition on a NAS. No fuss no nothing.
summary: Does exactly what it's intended to

description: I've only tested backing up at this point still need to test restore. But the process was simple. And I liked that it pre-selected some cache directories to be exempt from backup.

Timeshift ha dejado de funcionar en Fedora 36. Pika es un buen sino mejor sustituto. Permite explorar archivos de backup por tiempo que es muy útil. Falta la opción de backup de sistema parecido al de Timeshift que permitiese recuperar el sistema tamibién desde bash.
summary: Funciona perfectamenete y lo más importante que funcina en Fedora 36

description: The best backup app for gnome
summary: Use it both for local and remote backups. Works flawlessly!

description: Easy to use, great UI, good integration with the backend.
Slick UI, simple but powerful and fits in with Gnome perfectly. A shining example in the ecosystem.

Pika Backup has the clearest interface I've seen for the underlying utilities, and I've tested it both via intentional tests and by needing a backup multiple times, and the backups have been complete and solid each time. Has worked for me on attached drives and samba shares.
summary: Clear interface, tested many times personally

description: Works perfectly
It backed up my home dir perfectly onto my external hard drive. UI is good and easy to understand. What else is there to say? If you're after a GUI version of Borg, this is what I'd recommend.
The interface is easy to use and now includes very useful exclude patterns. Just as easy as DejaDup, but far better functionality.
Good and simple UI. I've been using it for some time and have encountered no issues. Confident in its abilities.
Very nice user interface. Apps like these make Gnome the best platform for general users. I could explain this app to my grandma.
flawless on fedora. nice interface et options.

Rather than a straight copy of my data over to an encrypted flash drive (my previous backup method), Pika Backup includes encryption and adds differential backups. Thus, it's super fast when doing subsequent backups. It's also fast and intuitive when you need to restore something from backup. 

My only gripe is that I couldn't manage large backups to my preferred cloud provider. Small backups worked, large ones (that is, a couple of GB or more) failed with a number of different error messages. I'm not sure if that's down to Pika or the cloud provider. But I'm still happy with Pika for encrypted backups to an external USB stick, which work flawlessly.
Works well, easy to use front end for Borg. However for a 9.7 MB app I ended up downloading 1.1 GB from flathub. App description says "NEEDS NO OTHER SOFTWARE". Beware of flatpak BLOAT!
The "recover" is to open the file manager and I need to "copy to" the localtion manually.
Thank you for your effort.
Very nice user interface. Apps like these make Gnome the best platform for general users.
"Failed to make archives available for browsing. Unspecified error."
Backup fails, cannot recognize a repository. Also cannot create any new repository. I tried smb and sftp options. There is no obvious way to edit the repository location for the existing backup.
It's good, but I rather want my backups on google drive
Good integration with Gnome & easy to use. Does the job and suits my needs perfectly without being too complicated. It handles like TimeMachine on MacOS.

I install this app using your sloooooooooow wanna-be App Store!

But, I cannot lunch it - except openiing up your slooooooow wanna-be App Store and click on Open!

Then, it works!

Fedora 39 with Gnome 45.whatever!

I used it on Steam Deck, and it looks easy to set up backups.
However, it took me for a while to figure out how on earth I can restore from backUps for the future.
Description and website contained the information but someone like me ( absolutely linux beginner) will maybe struggle to restore. To be fair I didn`t get it until action it.

Once, I understood the steps, it`s easy. But forgive me, I came from Windows environment where all I have to do is 1 click on a button for backup, and 1 click on another button to restore. 

Here, all I need to do is open the Pika Backup tool to mount the backups using “Browse saved files” under Archives tab. Then recover files or folder via opened file manager using copy & paste actions. 
This copy/paste method is new and somehow it was "hidden" from my eyes.

I guess I also need to make sure I have the same program version when I restore those files(whatever version I used for back ups).

I installed the Flatpak version as recommended but it immediately complains about a missing keyring. Seems to be a Gnome components that this app depends on but that's not included in the Flatpak. So if you run KDE Plasma or Xfce or any other desktop that's not Gnome, it will not work.

This is the dream backup solution for me. Simple as Time Machine backup (macOS's backup system) to setup and use, as powerful as Time Machine backup (and much more actually!), and incredibly more reliable than it.
It has never given me up, and the sheer amount of cutsomization and being able to mount older versions is just a game changer. Thank you!
Works perfectly. Super simple to use and integrates well with the rest of the gnome DE.
happy to have found a functioning b/u for my little linux

I switched from Deja Dup to Pika Backup and wow, what a huge improvement. I can actually add ignore patterns and set a bandwidth limit (with a custom --upload-ratelimit commandline argument), set before & after backup scripts, and stop it from backing up while i'm running on battery.
I love this so far, it's not replaced Vorta on my wife and parents machine, and I am testing it on mine. I love that it's got the flexibility and capability of BORG with a simple and polished UI.
Every once in a while you come across some software that is clearly crafted as opposed to simply written. Pika is one of those.
A well-designed backup solution. Congratulations, and thank you!
Tut alles, was ich mir von einem Backup-Programm erhoffe.

Eigentlich mag ich keine GUI basierten Backup Programme und habe bislang auf der Konsole rsync verwendet. Aber diese Form des Backup gefällt mir wirklich ausgesprochen gut. Ein wirklich sehr nützliches und schnörkelloses Programm.
summary: Stabil und umfangreich in der Funktion

description:
Endlich mal ein vernünftiges Backup-Programm, das sich einfach konfigurieren lässt ohne selbst fehleranfällig Skripte und Cron-Jobs anlegen zu müssen und das von sich aus sinnvolle Voreinstellungen für die zu sichernden Dateien anbietet.

Gute Integration in Gnome.
Funktionierte auf unterschidlichen Systemen auf Anhieb und sehr stabil
This software provides a lot of functionality, yet very easy to use.
Además de ser simple de usar y muy eficaz, también tiene un diseño muy pulido que facilita su uso para usuarios novatos
Fonctionnalité "Time Machine" permettant de retrouver une ancienne version d'un fichier, sauvegardes programmées, interface super agréable, bref magnifique.

Le soucis est qu'on a oublié la restauration des fichiers sauvegardés.Or une sauvegarde est faite pour pouvoir faire une restauration ....On peut ,cependant ,quand on accède aux archives faire du copier coller ,mas pour un logiciel de sauvegarde c'est un peu limite
Smooth, functional and well-designed. This should be the default backup app on GNOME IMO
LE top aprés une réinstallation fraiche pika est la .
Отличная прога, очень напоминает TimeMachine в os x
Приложение отличное! Резервная копия создаётся и восстановление из резервной копии выполняется без замечаний. Автору спасибо.
Ничего лишнего. Просто и понятно для обычного пользователя
Тащемта ломовейшая программа для создания бекапов, например. Желаю авторам крымских вин, а их герлам мощнейшего порева и треш-угарной содомии.
Сохранение понятно, а восстановление банальное копирование из резервной копии вручную? О приложениях и настройках можно забыть? Поучитесь у Mac OS делать резервные копии, а не лепить фуфло.
